title: New Sports System
alt: Under my system, boxing and football suffered, pair figure skating still worked but had to adapt by dropping some moves, and pro wrestling was actually completely unaffected.
transcript:
[Single wide frame representing a basketball court with a basketball goal at each end.  There are seven players running around the court, with a virtual ball in the bottom right corner (indicated by being drawn as a dashed circle).  Nine off-screen voices of "online viewers" are yelling instructions to the players.  A caption is below the frame running nearly the full width of the frame.]Viewer One: No!
Viewer Two: It's on the–
Viewer Three: Look out!
[A player with thick hair and a goatee is "air-shooting" into the left-hand basket.]
Viewer Four: No!
[A player with thick hair is running to the right.]
Viewer Five: He's right there. Don’t run into–
[A player with no hair is air-dribbling to the right.]
Viewer Six: Riiight!
Viewer Seven: Go left!
Viewer Eight: Left!
[A player with thick hair and a full beard is facing left and jumping, hands raised to intercept a ball.]
[A player with no hair is facing left and crouching, reaching for a ball.]
[A player is making an alley-oop motion towards the right-hand basket.]
Viewer Nine: Stop dunking and find the ball!
[The virtual ball is slowly moving right, unseen by the players]
[A player is hanging on the rim of the basket, making a dunking motion.][Caption below the panel:]
No one liked my new sports system, in which each player is in a separate arena sharing a single virtual ball that they can't see while online viewers yell instructions, but it was fun to watch while it lasted.
